meanings.definition: Having only one type of crystal structure.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the monoclinic crystal carefully.
meanings.sent2: The diamond exhibited a monoclinic structure under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The monoclinic crystal decided it wanted to be unique among the others.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as clear and structured as a monoclinic crystal.
meanings.sent5: The monoclinic crystal sparkled like a rare gem in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A type of crystal system with three unequal axes, two of which intersect at an oblique angle.
meanings.sent1: The geologist identified the monoclinic crystal system in the rock sample.
meanings.sent2: Crystals with a monoclinic structure often have distinct properties.
meanings.sent3: The monoclinic crystal system seemed to be playing a game of angles.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the city was a complex network of streets, like a monoclinic crystal system.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the monoclinic crystal system was mesmerizing under the light.
